message: Jeff (founder of stackoverflow) is explaining why they decided to build Discourse with Ruby not .NET like stackExchange
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: ruby is a very good large scaled development
C'mon Tarik. Many developers make claims like these everyday, give him a break, he is a designer even (Alaa, :P ).
Choice of programming language is about community & taste rather than the programming language itself

Actually for large scale, I would focus on the Architecture and communications and security framework. There will be a communications penalty to pay anyway. All connecting applications could be built in any language as long as they follow an agreed upon application meta-model (like an interface for Application Architecture)
